definition: to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
congee/making a living
variant of 糊[hu2]
muddled/paste/scorched
paste/cream
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Some of the farmers had quit farming and were cutting railroad ties so they could feed their families.
sentences.chinese: 有些农民放弃了耕作，靠砍伐铺铁路的枕木养家糊口。

sentences.english: We work. We strive to earn a living.
sentences.chinese: 我们工作，我们努力赚钱养家糊口。

sentences.english: I'm just making some kind of living in what I've been doing the last four years.
sentences.chinese: 我就是在用我这四年学到的东西养家糊口。

sentences.english: Father was too weak to support the family and the son was dragooned into stealing again.
sentences.chinese: 父亲体弱无力养家糊口，儿子又被迫行窃。

sentences.english: The workers send money home to support their families. These are called immigrant remittances.
sentences.chinese: 他们寄钱回家，以养家糊口，这称为移民汇款。

sentences.english: The peddlers went to every alley and street to make money to support their families.
sentences.chinese: 小商贩们走街串巷赚点小钱养家糊口。

sentences.english: L: Because I like having a job. I don't want to get canned.
sentences.chinese: 没办法得养家糊口啊，我可不想被炒了。

sentences.english: I know that I can love, raise a family and give birth to a healthy baby.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我可以去爱，养家糊口并生出一名健康的婴儿。

sentences.english: With financial resources exhausted and the pressure of a family to support, Jankowski's thoughts turned to escape.
sentences.chinese: 经济来源的枯竭和养家糊口的压力让他想到逃避。

sentences.english: My brother and I worked day and night to keep the family.
sentences.chinese: 我和我兄弟为了养家糊口而日夜操劳。

sentences.english: Males are expected to be breadwinners while females rear a family's only child.
sentences.chinese: 男人要养家糊口，而女人在家中抚养他们唯一的孩子。

sentences.english: We work to support our family and to promote ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 我们工作是为了养家糊口，也是为了自我发展。

sentences.english: Some felt so desperate that they began stealing to feed their families.
sentences.chinese: 一些人绝望了，以至于他们开始偷窃来养家糊口。

sentences.english: Many return to families crippled by debt from months without a breadwinner.
sentences.chinese: 许多人回到家中不能养家糊口，数月以来负债累累。

definition: to scrape a meager living/to get by with difficulty
variant of 糊口[hu2 kou3]
to support one's family (idiom)
to support a family/to raise a family
to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
livelihood
to make money
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
to provide for/to keep (animals, a family etc)/to raise animals/to feed and clothe/support/the necessities of life/to give birth
lit. to eat off one's own strength (idiom)/fig. to stand on one's own feet/to earn one's own living
to earn a living
(coll.) job/work
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
to live one's life/to make a living
to farm/to work the land
to have enough food and warm clothes/adequately provided
family livelihood/a household's economic situation/family property
